articles.description: Samsung Galaxy A52 5G alleged renders have been shared by OnLeaks via Voice and it seems to have the same design as the Galaxy A51. The upcoming phone may be powered by a Snapdragon 750G SoC and 6GB of RAM.
articles.content: Samsung Galaxy A52 5G seems to have the same design as the Galaxy A51, according to new renders shared by a known tipster. The rumoured phone could come with a hole-punch cut out for the selfie camer… [+1941 chars]

articles.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
articles.title: Apple reportedly hands over its self-driving car project to executive who oversees Siri - The Verge
articles.description: Apple is moving management of its self-driving car project to John Giannandrea, the head of AI and Siri. The company’s secretive Project Titan will now be run by Apple’s head of machine learning and AI strategy.
articles.content:
John Giannandrea, the head of AI, will now manage Project Titan
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Siri, drive my car... 
Apple is shuffling its leadership that oversees its secretive self-dr… [+1920 chars]

articles.author: Ricci Rox
articles.title: New OPPO Find X3 Pro leak may give an early look at the OnePlus 9 Pro - Notebookcheck.net
articles.description: The OPPO Find X3 Pro will succeed the highly lauded OPPO Find X2 Pro as OPPO's flagship device next year. Details of the phone look to have appeared already, with hardware that will likely be found on the OnePlus 9 Pro when it's released.
articles.content: OPPO released the OPPO Find X2 Pro at the start of the year. The Find X2 Pro was rightfully hailed as one of the most complete premium devices of the year and lent some of its DNA to the OnePlus 8 Pr… [+1200 chars]

articles.title: Apple Will Repair or Refund Your iPhone 11's Unresponsive Screen for Free - Lifehacker
articles.description:
Apple’s finally doing something about a mysterious iPhone 11 bug that  renders the phone’s screen unresponsive, and if it’s affecting your device, the fix will be free.

Reports of the bug started showing up as far back as June. Some users sought repairs, whi…
